definition: heddle (device to form warp in weaving textiles)/Taiwan pr. [zong4]
to sum up/to put together/Taiwan pr. [zong4]
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: In a word, Song-Confucianism exerts a far-reaching influence on Song Dynasty aesthetics.
sentences.chinese: 综上所述，宋代理学对宋代美学产生的影响是深远的。

sentences.english: To sum up: it is meaningful to limit the use of disposloclocated ation plastic.
sentences.chinese: 综上所述，这是居心义的限制一次性塑料的使用。

sentences.english: To conclude, the part-time job can make teenager'slife much harder.
sentences.chinese: 综上所述，兼职工作能够使青少年的生活更加努力。

sentences.english: So, in summary , I think caning has advantage for our society.
sentences.chinese: 所以，综上所述，我认为鞭刑有利于我们的社会治安。

sentences.english: In summary then, the new 1-series remains a flawed gem.
sentences.chinese: 综上所述，新的1系列仍然是一个有瑕疵的宝石。

sentences.english: All this leads up to the most fundamental of theorems of calculus .
sentences.chinese: 综上所述就导出了微积分学中的最基本的定理。

sentences.english: To sum up, dedicated chef is the restaurant industry development potential and power.
sentences.chinese: 综上所述，敬业名厨是餐饮业发展的潜力和动力。

sentences.english: With all that in mind, what can Knick fans realistically expect from Rose?
sentences.chinese: 综上所述，尼克斯球迷对罗斯现实的期望应该是啥？
